sentences.sContent: Each individual receives two genes, one inherited from each parent.
sentences.sCn: 每个人都有两种基因，分别来自父亲和母亲。

sentences.sContent: Most churches were built with donations from private individuals (= ordinary people, rather than the government or companies ).
sentences.sCn: 大多数教堂都是由私人捐款建成的。

sentences.sContent: ...The development of self-consciousness and the notion of individual identity...
...with individual chapters costing as little as $2...
...but also by making better individual decisions...
...and based on the individual needs of each child...
...but Yorkshire Pudding will bring full dished to the table and offer individual plates for each dinner...
...Such incidents take a tremendous toll on our nation's economy and our individual well-being...
...strong will is an important condition or role of the success the individual should desire to maintain forever...
...She was puzzled and somewhat disappointed because she liked the individual otherwise...

phrases.pCn: 个人价值，个体价值；个别值

remMethod.val: in(不) ＋ divid(看作divide， 分， 划分) ＋ ual → 不可再分的 → 个体

words.tran: 个人主义的；利己主义的
个人的；有个性的；具有个人特色的
个人主义；利己主义；个人特征
利己主义者，个人主义者
使…个性化；分别详述（individualize的过去分词）
赋予个性；个别处理；使适应个别需要
个别化；表现区别；一一列举；赋予个性；使个体化

trans.tranOther: a person, considered separately from the rest of the group or society that they live in
